meanings.definition: The measure of a material's ability to store electrical energy in an electric field.
meanings.sent1: The permittivity of the substance determines how much electrical energy it can hold.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the permittivity of different materials to understand their electrical properties.
meanings.sent3: The permittivity of the rubber band seemed to make it stretch further than usual when charged with static electricity.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had a high permittivity for absorbing new information, like a sponge soaking up water.
meanings.sent5: The permittivity of the capacitor was so high that it could store a large amount of charge.

meanings.definition: The ratio of the electric displacement in a dielectric to the electric field producing it.
meanings.sent1: The permittivity of the dielectric material affected the efficiency of the capacitor.
meanings.sent2: Engineers need to consider the permittivity of the insulating material when designing electronic devices.
meanings.sent3: The permittivity of the plastic wrap made it seem like the sandwich inside was invisible to the electric field.
meanings.sent4: The permittivity of the air around us is like an invisible force that influences the behavior of charged particles.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the permittivity of a medium is crucial for predicting how it will interact with electric fields.
